value.title: The Coming Technology Boom

value.title: These 2 Stock Market EV and Self-Driving Favorites Soared Today

value.title: CBP Facial Recognition Scanners Failed to Find a Single Imposter At Airports in 2020
value.excerpt: Customs and Border Protection used facial recognition tools to scan over 23 million travelers’ faces at 30-plus points of entry in 2020, and failed to turn up a single example of an individual impersonating someone else at an airport,

value.title: Researchers propose platform for evaluating disease-forecasting AI methods
value.excerpt: Researchers at the University of Southern California propose a platform --EpiBench -- to compare disease-forecasting AI models.

value.title: 2 Self-Driving Car Stocks to Buy in 2021
value.excerpt: Self-driving cars will change the world in countless ways. They hold the promise of riders being able to engage in other activities while in a vehicle, collisions and traffic deaths being significantly reduced,

value.title: 5 Ways For Startups To Take Advantage Of AI
value.excerpt: Others use AI to improve everything from customer service operations to digital marketing. Up until recently though, the best AI solutions were only accessible to big, well-funded corporations. Now, that's no longer the case.

value.title: SPAC Led By Former Medtronic CEO Focusing On Artificial Intelligence In Healthcare
value.excerpt: Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare is an exciting sector and a good focus area for SPACs seeking high growth companies.

value.title: New AI technique allows robots to detect human touch by analyzing shadows
value.excerpt: Scientists from Cornell University say the method provides a low-cost way for robots to identify physical interactions with humans.

value.title: "Face control": Russian police go digital against protesters
value.excerpt: Georgy Malets didn't make it to an anti-Kremlin rally last month. He was detained on his way there by police using facial recognition technology in the Moscow metro.

value.title: A Small College Hopes to Claim Artificial Intelligence for the Liberal Arts

value.title: NHL reaches deal with AWS to put all video and data on the cloud

value.title: AWS, IBM, Google, and Microsoft are taking AI from 1.0 to 2.0, according to Forrester
value.excerpt: A new report says that the hyperscalers are using reinforcement learning and transformer networks to make AI smarter and more mobile.

value.title: Immunai raises $60 million to analyze the immune system with AI
value.excerpt: Immunai, a startup developing an AI platform for biomarker discovery, has raised $60 million in venture funding.

value.title: The Nine Ground Rules For A Driving Robot That Can Drive A Non-Driverless Car
value.excerpt: These are the nine key ground rules for devising a driving robot that will turn any car into essentially a self-driving car.

value.title: Microsoft to support HPE's Spaceborne Computer with Azure connectivity, AI processing at the edge
value.excerpt: Microsoft and HPE are partnering to bring together Azure and the Spaceborne Computer-2 supercomputer, making it the ultimate edge-computing device.

value.title: Nvidia: Researchers train AI to reward dogs for responding to commands
value.excerpt: Researchers Jason Stock and Tom Cavey have published a paper on an AI system that rewards dogs for doing tricks.

value.title: ‘Hear’ this Kandinsky painting with Google’s psychedelic AI tool
value.excerpt: Google Arts & Culture's latest machine learning experiment explores the artist's synesthesia and the connections between music and painting.

value.title: Bowery CTO Injong Rhee on the grand challenge of AI for indoor farming
value.excerpt: Bowery has opened what it calls ones of the largest indoor farming R&D operations in the world to tackle challenges using machine learning.

value.title: Microsoft and Volkswagen will collaborate on self-driving car software
value.excerpt: VW plans to use Microsoft's expertise to build a cloud-based platform for future autonomous technologies and driver-assist systems.

value.title: Intenseye raises $4M to boost workplace safety through computer vision
value.excerpt: Workplace injuries and illnesses cost the U.S. upwards of $250 billion each year, according to the Economic Policy Institute. ERA-backed startup Intenseye, a machine learning platform, has raised a $4 million seed round to try to bring that number way down in an economic and efficient way.

value.title: Tech Companies Want AI to Fix the Disastrous Vaccine Rollout
value.excerpt: As people struggle to book appointments and doses go unused, some companies are proposing automated tools to help deliver vaccines into arms.

value.title: Israeli firm TikTalk brings AI to speech therapy
value.excerpt: The global market for speech therapists is believed to be valued at more than $60 billion, with about 40% of that in the US.

value.title: How Big Data, Predictive Analytics And Machine Learning Changed The Railway Industry
value.excerpt: Learn how KTZ leveraged SAP Innovative Business Solutions to create a single platform capable of processing vast volumes of cargo and freight data.
